data.title: Facts, Childhood, Family Life & Achievements
data.meta_description: A behind-the-scene look at the life of Michael S. Dell.
data.text:
Michael S. Dell attended the University of Texas at Austin, but he dropped out in order to focus on his business ventures.

Michael S. Dell started his career by founding his own company, originally named "PC's Limited," from his dorm room at the University of Texas at Austin.

The "Dell Dude" was a popular spokesperson in Dell's advertising campaigns during the early 2000s, helping to increase brand recognition and consumer appeal.

Michael S. Dell currently serves as the chairman and CEO of Dell Technologies, overseeing the strategic direction and operations of the company.

Michael S. Dell is known for his philanthropic efforts through the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, which focuses on improving education, healthcare, and economic stability for underprivileged communities.

He started his computer business from his dorm room at the University of Texas, where he sold upgrade kits for personal computers.

Dell is known for his philanthropic efforts, including founding the Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, which focuses on improving the health and education of children around the world.

He is an avid collector of contemporary art and has a personal art collection that includes works by artists such as Pablo Picasso and Jackson Pollock.
